title: Three Worlds of Instructional Design (ID): Real-World Problem-Based Strategies for Integrating Knowledge, Learning, and Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design theory and professional work experience
context.additional_context: A course focused on solving real-world job-related problems in smartphone-centric, technology-constrained environments

learning_goals: Learners can systematically design learning outcomes for professional fields through knowledge structure analysis.

Learners apply five optimization strategies (e.g., chunking, visual cues) based on Cognitive Load Theory (CLT) to three or more real-world problem scenarios (e.g., code refactoring, system bottleneck analysis) and propose solutions improving task efficiency by 20% or more.

Learners develop a certified assessment tool (e.g., Python/Django or Node.js) applicable to job environments, implement a real-time text feedback system based on user responses, and meet internal standards (80% functionality, 70% usability).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
